title: Vintage Glove Fashion
description: Test your knowledge of the era when no outfit was complete without the proper pair of gloves!

questions.question: In the 1940s and 1950s, when was it considered proper etiquette for a woman to wear gloves?
questions.explanation: Through the 1950s, well-dressed women wore gloves whenever leaving the house, whether shopping, going to church, or attending social events. It was considered incomplete to go without them.

questions.question: What long, elegant gloves reaching above the elbow were traditionally worn with formal evening gowns?
questions.explanation: Opera gloves, extending past the elbow to the upper arm, were the required accessory for formal evening wear, especially with sleeveless or short-sleeved gowns.

questions.question: What type of short, wrist-length cotton gloves was the everyday choice for women in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Shortie gloves (wrist-length cotton or nylon gloves) were the everyday accessory for women in the 1950s, worn for shopping, errands, and casual outings.

questions.question: According to 1950s etiquette, when should a woman remove her gloves at a formal dinner?
questions.explanation: Etiquette dictated that gloves should be removed when sitting down to eat, though they could be kept on for cocktails and dancing at a formal event.

questions.question: What material were the most luxurious dress gloves typically made from?
questions.explanation: Kid leather (made from young goat skin) was the most prized material for dress gloves, known for its extreme softness and supple fit.

questions.question: Which Hollywood icon performed a famous glove-removing scene in the 1946 film 'Gilda'?
questions.explanation: Rita Hayworth's legendary long glove removal scene in 'Gilda' (1946) is one of the most famous and sensual moments in classic cinema.

questions.question: What color gloves were considered the most versatile and essential in every woman's wardrobe during the 1950s?
questions.explanation: White gloves were the most versatile choice, considered appropriate for most daytime occasions and essential for spring and summer outfits.

questions.question: What button closure system, featuring small pearl-like buttons at the wrist, was commonly found on dress gloves?
questions.explanation: Mousquetaire buttons were the traditional button openings at the wrist or inside of long gloves, allowing the hand portion to be opened for eating while keeping the glove on.

questions.question: In which decade did gloves largely disappear from everyday women's fashion?
questions.explanation: The 1960s saw the decline of everyday glove-wearing as fashion became more casual and youthful, though gloves remained for formal occasions.

questions.question: What specialty store existed in many department stores and downtowns specifically for buying gloves?
questions.explanation: Dedicated glove counters in department stores and standalone glove shops were common through the 1950s, offering expert fitting and a wide selection.

questions.question: What finger-free glove style became fashionable for driving in the 1960s and 1970s?
questions.explanation: Fingerless leather driving gloves, with knuckle holes and a snap closure at the back of the hand, were a stylish automotive accessory in the 1960s and 1970s.

questions.question: According to 1950s etiquette, what should a woman do with her gloves when shaking hands?
questions.explanation: According to etiquette of the era, a woman could keep her gloves on when shaking hands, unlike men who were expected to remove their gloves for a handshake.

questions.question: What delicate fabric was often used for summer church gloves in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Lace gloves, light and breathable, were a popular choice for church and summer events in the 1950s, adding a feminine touch to Sunday best outfits.

questions.question: What singer famously wore a single sequined glove as a signature fashion statement in the 1980s?
questions.explanation: Michael Jackson's single white sequined glove became one of the most iconic fashion accessories in pop music history, debuting on the 1983 Motown special.

questions.question: How were gloves traditionally measured for proper fit at a glove counter?
options: By measuring the hand's circumference at the knuckles
questions.explanation: Glove size was determined by measuring around the widest part of the hand across the knuckles. A trained salesperson would use a tape measure for a perfect fit.
